data_structure.description: Comprehensive Italian profanity database with regional variations and gesture-related expressions

entry_format.variations: Common variations, regional forms, and obfuscations
entry_format.target_type: Whether it targets individuals, groups, or is general
entry_format.regions: Regions where this term is commonly used

words.context_notes: Very common Italian profanity, used as exclamation and body part reference
what the fuck do you want
Testicle, also means idiot, moderately offensive
Cuckold, implies wife's infidelity, often with hand gesture
Christ, used as exclamation, religious sensitivity varies
Fuck off, often accompanied by hand gesture
Vulgar term for female genitalia, also used as positive adjective
Son of a whore, very offensive compound insult
Homophobic slur meaning fennel, very offensive
Homophobic slur, extremely offensive to LGBTQ+ community
Jesus, used as exclamation, religious sensitivity varies
Virgin Mary reference, severity varies by religious context and region
Damn, mild curse often euphemism for stronger religious profanity
Sicilian for penis, also general exclamation
your dead relatives - Southern insult, Southern Italy
Racial slur, extremely offensive and inappropriate
Northern Italian for idiot/fool, mild insult
Regional slur against Northern Italians, moderately offensive
Sow/pig, often used in religious expletives 'porca madonna'
Very offensive religious blasphemy, pig Virgin Mary
Pig God, extremely offensive religious blasphemy
Whore, highly offensive when targeting women
Stupid/fool, mild insult often used affectionately
Unlucky person/loser, mild to moderate insult
Piece of shit, common insult meaning asshole
peasant - offensive to Southern Italians (feminine), Southern Italy
Regional slur against Southern Italians, very offensive
Slut/whore, very offensive to women, from Troy reference
Go fuck yourself, very common strong insult
go die murdered - Roman, Central Italy/Roman
uncle - can be offensive in some contexts

gesture_integration.description: Italian profanity heavily integrated with hand gestures

ombrello_gesture.cultural_note: Umbrella gesture, equivalent to middle finger

mano_a_borsa.cultural_note: What the hell gesture, very common

northern_italy.notes: More industrial, less religious sensitivity, unique terms like 'pirla'
northern_italy.blasphemy_pattern: More tolerance for religious profanity than South

central_italy.notes: Roman influence, balanced between North and South patterns

southern_italy.notes: Stronger Catholic influence, more family honor concepts

sicily.notes: Distinct Sicilian dialect creates unique profanity patterns
sicily.blasphemy_pattern: Strong Catholic influence affects religious profanity

sardinia.notes: Sardinian language influences create distinct patterns

linguistic_patterns.gender_agreement: Italian adjectives and nouns must agree in gender (stronzo/stronza)
linguistic_patterns.diminutives: Can soften or intensify meaning (stronzetto, puttanella)
linguistic_patterns.regional_variants: Many terms have different forms across regions
linguistic_patterns.gesture_integration: Many profane expressions integrated with specific hand gestures

blasphemy_system.description: Italian has elaborate religious blasphemy system
blasphemy_system.regional_sensitivity: Northern Italy more tolerant, Southern Italy more sensitive
blasphemy_system.legal_implications: Some blasphemy can violate Italian law

english_speakers.english_confusion: Very common, not as taboo as English 'cock'
